publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5413 Maureen Macmillan: Electric Shock Training Collars for Dogs—That the Parliament notes the undertaking by the Scottish Executive to examine the case for banning the use of electric shock training collars for dogs; further notes that Carwyn Jones AM, Minister for Environment, Planning and Countryside in the Welsh Assembly Government, has announced his intention to seek to ban these collars in Wales, and therefore asks that the Scottish Executive reports on the progress of its consultations with animal welfare groups and others. Supported by: Dr Sylvia Jackson* Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support

S2M-5413 Electric Shock Training Collars for Dogs (lodged on 15 January 2007) Bill Butler*, Nora Radcliffe*, Alex Neil*, Christine May*, Frances Curran*, Carolyn Leckie*, Rosie Kane*, Robin Harper*, Jackie Baillie*, Ms Sandra White*, Helen Eadie*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Scott Barrie*, Marilyn Livingstone*
S2M-5413 Electric Shock Training Collars for Dogs (lodged on 15 January 2007) Trish Godman*, Dave Petrie*
S2M-5413 Electric Shock Training Collars for Dogs (lodged on 15 January 2007) Christine Grahame*, Tommy Sheridan*

S2M-5413 Maureen Macmillan: Electric Shock Training Collars for Dogs—That the Parliament notes the undertaking by the Scottish Executive to examine the case for banning the use of electric shock training collars for dogs; further notes that Carwyn Jones AM, Minister for Environment, Planning and Countryside in the Welsh Assembly Government, has announced his intention to seek to ban these collars in Wales, and therefore asks that the Scottish Executive reports on the progress of its consultations with animal welfare groups and others. Supported by: Dr Sylvia Jackson, Bill Butler, Nora Radcliffe, Alex Neil, Christine May, Frances Curran, Carolyn Leckie, Rosie Kane, Robin Harper, Jackie Baillie, Ms Sandra White, Helen Eadie, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Dr Elaine Murray, Scott Barrie, Marilyn Livingstone, Trish Godman, Dave Petrie, Christine Grahame, Tommy Sheridan, Dennis Canavan*
S2M-5413 Electric Shock Training Collars for Dogs (lodged on 15 January 2007) Chris Ballance*
S2M-5413 Electric Shock Training Collars for Dogs (lodged on 15 January 2007) Eleanor Scott*
S2M-5413 Electric Shock Training Collars for Dogs (lodged on 15 January 2007) Cathy Peattie*
S2M-5413 Electric Shock Training Collars for Dogs (lodged on 15 January 2007) Linda Fabiani*
S2M-5413 Electric Shock Training Collars for Dogs (lodged on 15 January 2007) Dr Jean Turner*

S2M-5413 Maureen Macmillan: Electric Shock Training Collars for Dogs—That the Parliament notes the undertaking by the Scottish Executive to examine the case for banning the use of electric shock training collars for dogs; further notes that Carwyn Jones AM, Minister for Environment, Planning and Countryside in the Welsh Assembly Government, has announced his intention to seek to ban these collars in Wales, and therefore asks that the Scottish Executive reports on the progress of its consultations with animal welfare groups and others. Supported by: Dr Sylvia Jackson, Bill Butler, Nora Radcliffe, Alex Neil, Christine May, Frances Curran, Carolyn Leckie, Rosie Kane, Robin Harper, Jackie Baillie, Ms Sandra White, Helen Eadie, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Dr Elaine Murray, Scott Barrie, Marilyn Livingstone, Trish Godman, Dave Petrie, Christine Grahame, Tommy Sheridan, Dennis Canavan, Chris Ballance, Eleanor Scott, Cathy Peattie, Linda Fabiani, Dr Jean Turner
